Title: Bet On Soldier

About This Game

In a world where war has been waged for 80 years, the general public revel in televised transmissions of battles, which rage right across the globe.
The best soldiers have become celebrity A-listers and their fights draw incredibly huge bets.

You take on the role of one of these soldiers and have to forge a career for yourself as a champion, idolized by the masses! If you get tired of the massacring, join up with the resistance and fight the system. They’ve seen you're a natural born leader!


KEY POINTS:
  • Bet and kill to earn enough money to survive
  • Travel the four corners of the earth, with more than 40 champions to beat in 25 missions
  • Non-linear storyline with two possible endings
  • Full, evolving arsenal with over 40 weapons
  • Two endings - choose your own destiny
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows® XP/Vista/7
    • Processor: Pentium® IV 3 Ghz (or above)
    • Memory: 1 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Minimum 3D Card 64Mb or higher,
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    • Sound Card: Supporting DirectX
    • Additional Notes: 100% supporting Directx9.0c, Pixel & Vertex Shader, required (Nvidia Geforce 4, ATI 9700 or equivalent)

3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
McDouggal
65 products in account
2 reviews
Not Recommended
5.9 hrs on record
Posted: October 10
Initial impressions - sound design is meh. Animations and graphics are dated, as to be expected since the game was released in 2005.

Controls are weird; if you've been running and let off the W key, you will sometimes stop immediately and other times you will slide about 5 feet. This seems to happen no matter what terrain you are on.

some of the special powers are also stupid. Guns that blind you whenever you get hit seem like a cool idea right when you start, but in order to get your vision back you need to stop getting hit, which requires cover, which you can't find since you're blind. The hallucinogen grenades are ♥♥♥♥ing stupid. "Let's give an AoE attack that some bosses can spam that is even more frustrating than the blind guns because you can see you just will never be able to accurately shoot."

There is a huge weapon imbalance as well. There is no reason to run with an AR or Commando rifle, since the SMG's seem to have better accuracy, more damage, and a higher magazine capacity (which is greatly important for this game, since a mag you drop, even if you only fired one round out of it, is GONE until you get a chance to buy more ammo). The sniper rifles as a class are also obscenely strong; you can two shot anyone except the most heavily armored mooks with headshots. Those heavy armor mooks take 3, while it will take multiple MAGAZINES to spray down those heavy armored mooks with an AR/Commando rifle.

Shooting mechanics. Standard FPS, although for whatever stupid reason your zoom function is bound to your mousewheel click. Snipers are overpowered (in your hands, not the AI. The AI snipers suck) not just in terms of damage they deal, but also because this game seems to have some compensation for where you aim with the snipers, at least at the difficulty I played at. Several times, I would be aiming high chest and I would get headshot kills. I probably got more headshots like that than I did actually aiming at the head. Object hitboxes also tend to be weird, and you often can't tell until you've fired a shot into a clear area that it was actually an invisible wall.

All in all, I ended up ragequitting at stage 7. Not because the game was hard, but because a few minor irritants and one major one all added up to the game not being fun to play.

3/10, would NOT recommend.
Read More

Mostly Harmless
579 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
17.5 hrs on record
Posted: December 7, 2014
Bet on Soldier is a European-made, non-triple-A First Person Shooter from the mid-00's, the era of Doom 3, Unreal 2, Far Cry 1, F.E.A.R. 1, Killzone 1, etc. It plays mostly like a typical FPS from that period.

Combat is more arcade-like than in modern war FPS; enemies dodge and strafe quite a lot, and if they're wearing body armor it takes several bullet hits to break their armor before you can kill them. Levels can be quite large, with many open outdoor areas, although moving through levels is a fairly linear path. There is no aiming down iron sights; aiming your weapon simply causes your view to zoom in.

Voice acting and cutscenes are fairly typical of most European, non-triple-A games... in other words, pretty much MST3000 quality. Though the gameplay is solid and the graphics are actually pretty good for the time period (comparable to games like Unreal 2, Doom 3, or Butcher Bay). While production values are lower than a triple-A title, they are decent and MUCH higher than something like Chernobyl Commando or Alpha Black Zero.

The game's main distinguishing feature is that everything revolves around money. Instead of picking up health and bullets from enemies, you earn money from killing them and spend it at reload stations to refill your ammo and armor. Not having to worry about picking up items means you can focus entirely on the combat; the flip side is that if you're wasteful with your bullets or armor, you can run out of money and be unable to proceed further.

The game is harder than average, but not as difficult as the hardest FPS games from that period. It is, for example, a lot less frustrating than Iron Storm was.

The Steam version seems to run perfectly fine on modern systems, and has even been updated to support 1080p resolution (up to 1920x1080) natively, without needing to mess around with the cfg files. This was a pleasant surprise. I am playing on Windows 7 64 bit and have not experienced any bugs or crashes after 3 missions.

Multiplayer uses the defunct Gamespy Arcade and crashes instantly for me, so I wouldn't count on it.

I would recommend it if you've played it back in the day and want to play it again, or if you enjoy mid-00 shooters and have some experience with European-developed FPS titles (i.e. Chrome, Chaser, Iron Storm, Alpha Prime, Boiling Point/Xenus, Exodus from the Earth, Ubersoldier, etc.)and thus can go in knowing there will be some rough edges to expect.

Riskbreaker
11 products in account
4 reviews
Recommended
4.2 hrs on record
Posted: December 12, 2014
Very good old school FPS, I found it entertaining and original.

The gameplay with the idea of the exoskull armor is cool and allows the player to play with different styles from the hardcore killer rushing everywhere and killing as much opponents as possible to earn money and repair the armor to the complete tactitian playing with support from an ingenior and progressing in the game while being repaired by him.

The good variety of weapons and the old school graphics make this FPS a must play if you want to get rid of your brain for a while and have fun! :D

Do not forget to save the game (first game I've played in which you have to pay game money to save, very funny) because the difficulty of the game can be challenging if you do not take a carreful eye on your armor at all time!

Have a good blood bath guys :0

Posted: December 6, 2014
Old school, brutal, and manly all of these describe this game. One of my favorite games from back in the day. Was hoping for Steam to get this game and it did to bad its not the most up to date version. BOS had a very unique take on the FPS genre and honestly as a game dev I plan to 1 day make a game very similar to this on a new engine with better graphics. Anyways buy this game its lots of fun if you like innovative game play and lots of manly man testosterone, and battle mechs don't forget about the pew pew.

Bigguy Foryou
191 products in account
8 reviews
Recommended
4.5 hrs on record
Posted: December 12, 2014
The voice acting is even worse than Men of War, but the gameplay is quick, crazy, and there is a fair share of customization to be done when it comes to your inventory. The story is cheesy but the setting is interesting. It is worth mentioning that this is actually a sequel of sorts to Iron Storm as well.

Graphics were pretty good for the time and overall the game is great entertainment for its price. Despite its age the game works very well, which is an interesting point given that when it was originally released hardly anybody was able to play it due to an absolutely crippling amount of bugs in both running, loading, saving, and installing.

This game may also be made by wizards, I found I had access to some of my saves from 2005, long before I had a Steam or even used my current screen name, and I have been through several gaming computers since. Definitely witchcraft or sorcery, no doubt about it.

Pros:
Quick mindless gunplay
Customization
Lots of weapons and levels
Sweet armor
Alternate history setting

Cons:
Mediocre graphics
Embarassing voice acting
Forgettable storyline
Cutscenes drag on a bit
